Context:
The text describes a graduate certificate program in Building Information Modeling (BIM) offered by George Brown College. The program is designed to help students utilize BIM tools and implement BIM Management processes in any organization involved in the construction industry. Students have access to advanced BIM lab facilities, and semester 3 includes practical learning in a work environment with online and short modules in practical skills.

Companies that accept students for field experience include architectural, engineering, general contracting firms, subcontracting companies, government building departments, project developers, construction management firms, suppliers, and building manufacturing firms. Students must complete 450 hours of field experience. The college assists students in securing a field experience position but makes no guarantee. It is expected that students will be compensated for their field experience.

Graduates of the program can apply to graduate schools after completion, and there is an opportunity for students to engage in BIM-related applied research while completing the program. The field experience is typically completed in semester 3.

KEY INFORMATION:
- Program: Building Information Modeling (BIM)
- Offered by: George Brown College
- Access to advanced BIM lab facilities
- Semester 3 includes practical learning and online modules
- Companies for field experience: architectural, engineering, general contracting firms, subcontracting companies, government building departments, project developers, construction management firms, suppliers, and building manufacturing firms
- Students must complete 450 hours of field experience
- Compensation for field experience is expected
- Graduates can apply to graduate schools after completion
- Opportunity for BIM-related applied research during the program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Building Information Modeling Management Program (BIM) (Postgraduate) T412 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The college offers a BIM (Building Information Modeling) program with various career opportunities upon graduation such as BIM modeler, BIM specialist, BIM technologist, BIM coordinator, BIM construction officer, BIM manager, energy modeler, and 3D laser scanner. The program includes required courses in semesters 1, 2, and 3, which cover topics like BIM management, Revit-Architecture, Building Energy Modeling, and Field Experience Preparation. Semester 3 includes a mandatory field experience of 450 hours. Additional courses offered online include Construction Business Management and Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers. The tuition & fees for domestic students is $9,467.00 * and international students is $26,211.00 **.

* Semesters: 3
* Career opportunities: BIM modeler, BIM specialist, BIM technologist, BIM coordinator, BIM construction officer, BIM manager, energy modeler, 3D laser scanner
* Required courses: BIM 1002 to BIM 1024
* Semester 1 courses: BIM – Management, BIM – Pre-Construction Visualization, BIM – Revit-Architecture, BIM – Revit-Structures & MEP, BIM – Civil 3D
* Semester 2 courses: BIM – Implementation Strategies, BIM – Project Planning, Building Energy Modeling, BIM – Capstone Project, BIM Techniques – 3D Scanning, Field Experience Preparation
* Semester 3 courses: Field Experience (450h), Construction Business Management (online), Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers (Online)
* Tuition & Fees: Domestic - $9,467.00 *, International - $26,211.00 **

No other factual information was provided in the text.

Context:
Program Starting Dates and Fees:
- Fall 2022: Total fees for domestic students is $9,467, paid in installments of $3,417 (fall semester), $3,052 (winter semester), and $2,998 (spring semester). International students are advised to visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for information.
- Fall 2023: Total fees are subject to change and are currently unknown.
- Programs starting from Fall 2024 and later: Fees are subject to change.

Financial Assistance:
- This program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet the eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- A Bachelor's degree or Advanced Diploma (3-year) in Construction, Civil, Mechanical, Electrical and Landscape Engineering, Architectural Studies and Interior Design is required.
- Domestic applicants with international transcripts require a Canadian equivalency evaluation from ICAS or WES.
- International students with international transcripts are required to provide English proficiency test results or undergo the George Brown College English assessment.

Course Exemptions:
- For more information, visit the Transfer Guide.

Special Requirements:
- Students in the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management are strongly recommended to own or purchase a laptop and arrange for home Internet service.

Context:
The School of Construction Management at George Brown College recommends that students own or purchase a laptop with the following specifications:

- Operating system: Windows 10 Home 64-bit English
- Processor: 9th Generation Intel® Core™ i7-9750H (12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz, 6 cores)
- Memory (RAM): 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz)
- Disk space: 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive (Boot) + 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive (Storage)
- Display card: NVIDIA® GeForce RTX™ 2060 6GB GDDR6
- Connectivity: 802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth, 2 x 2
- Ports: 1x HDMI 2.0; 3x SuperSpeed USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A including 1x with PowerShare; 1x 2-in-1 SD / MicroMedia Card slot; 1x Wedge lock slot
- Screen size: minimum 15.6 inch FHD(1920 x 1080) 300nits IPS Anti-Glare LED backlit display with 144Hz refresh rate
- Audio: 1 combo headphone / microphone jack

Students are advised to have a laptop with these specifications and home Internet service with 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms. The purchase of a Mac laptop is not recommended due to compatibility issues with the programs used in the college.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

For more information about the School of Construction Management or George Brown College in general, contact Angelo DelZotto at construction_mgmt@georgebrown.ca or visit the campus during office hours at room E228, or call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. International students can also contact recruitment representatives specialized by country of origin through the International Contact Us page.
